items.title: 10 years back stop same place justice for Alonzo Ashley
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

10 years back stop same place justice for Alonzo Ashley

Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

‚ÄúWe are really sorry‚Äù: 10 years after a man lost his life at the hands of police at the Denver Zoo, an apology comes

Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f‚Ä¶Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f‚Ä¶

items.title: 10 years ago, we were honoring the life of Alonzo Ashely. Today...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

10 years ago, we were honoring the life of Alonzo Ashely. Today we come back to the same place to keep honoring his life and supporting his family. It doesn‚Äôt matter how much time passes by, we will keep remembering the life of every person of color, black and brown, that has been killed in the hands of police. One day we will end with this practice of abuse, creating legislations to take away the protection of all those corrupt police officers that think that just because they have a badge, it gives them permission to kill our people. Marking the life of families, we will keep marching in the streets to end police brutality.

An Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing a traffic stop that turned violent.An Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing a traffic stop that turned violent.

items.title: Hello Denver and beyond, please make sure you mark your...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Hello Denver and beyond, please make sure you mark your calendar‚Äòs for this Friday, October 1 from 4 to 6 PM.

Here is what happened:
Alanzo Ashley was at the zoo with his family in 2011. This man began to visibly display symptoms of heat strokeÔøºÔøºÔøº. Alonzo should have been treated with medical care by Zoo staff and any other responding personnel, instead Denver police were called and when they arrived they tackled him and used a taser when they did not need to and as a result... his heart stopped.

Who took responsibility:
After a 10 year up hill battle with no one from the city or the zoo even offering as little as an apology to the family in the mourning or a community in outrageÔøº. After a law suit and many years of protesting outside of the zoo, after distributing water bottles and information regarding what happened.ÔøºÔøº

October 1st from 4:00 - 6:00:
The zoo staff coordinated by Dr. Mosby Tyler have been working with Ôøºthe family, around the development of a water fountain and cooling station in memory of Alonzo Ashley. This memorial will be unveiled this Friday, October 1 between 4 PM and 6 PM. Friends Family and Community are welcomeÔøºÔøº, Zoo admission will be free to those who attend.

Link to event here:

https://facebook.com/events/s/in-memory-of-alonzo-ashley/541435653623950/

items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

On Monday Lupe received a cancer diagnosis. She‚Äôs been suffering from a hernia for the last year, which has gone untreated because the hospital wouldn‚Äôt operate on someone without health insurance. While monitoring the hernia, they discovered that she also has renal cancer. The full story and a link to her gofundme can be found at https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-lupe-pay-for-cancer-hernia-‚Ä¶. Please share, support, and pray for her full recovery. ‚ù§Ô∏è

For the last year, Lupe has been suffering from an abdominal hernia. It‚Äôs be‚Ä¶ Sofia Halpin needs your support for Help Lupe Pay for Cancer & Hernia Treatment

The deportation of Haitian migrants is a stark example of how President Biden has deployed some of the most aggressive approaches to immigration put in place by former President Donald J. Trump.

The images could have come straight from former President Donald J. Trump‚Äôs immigration playbook: mounted Border Patrol agents rounding up desperate Haitian families at the southwestern border for rapid deportation from the United States.
